result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Hearing Returned for 5-4-22 from Duluth.

Defendant must post $1,000 additional cash bond (for a total of $1,500 to cover Burnett County cases 22CF53 and 22CM31) to be released from custody.  No contact with the victim or residence, unless or until there is a written request for "no abusive contact" made through the District Attorney's office.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of firearms.  The defendant may make 1 trip to the residence with law enforcement to collect his personal belongings.

9:22 AM Cases 22CF53 and 22CM31 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandyn James Nelson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Brandyn James Nelson. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: requests additional status conference.  Court orders $1000 additional cash bond.  Atty Pollak to reach out to comp evaluator.
Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
$1,000 cash bond is ordered to cover warrants in Burnett County cases 22CF53 and 22CM31.  Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

12:00 PM Cases 22CF53 and 22CM31 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandyn James Nelson not in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Brandyn James Nelson.  Def fails to appear.  Court makes record.  State makes no comment- realized that has represented def previously.  Court orders warrant, forfeits cash.  $1000 cash bond on warrant, only judge may quash.
